com.readytalk.swt.util

Class FontFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.readytalk.swt.util.FontFactory

  • public class FontFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    FontFactory is meant as a central repository for getting colors so that we don't allocate duplicates everywhere; this can greatly decrease the number of fonts we allocate.

    • Method Detail

      • getFont

        public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font getFont(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device dev)
        Gives you a font with the default size, normal style, and default font. Clients should not dispose the font returned by this function call, as the owner is FontFactory.
        Parameters:
        dev - Device object off of which to create the font.
        Returns:
        Font

      • getFont

        public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font getFont(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device dev,
                                    int size)
        Gives you a font with the specified size, normal style, and default font. Clients should not dispose the font returned by this function call, as the owner is FontFactory.
        Parameters:
        dev - Device object off of which to create the font.
        Returns:
        Font

      • getFont

        public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font getFont(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device dev,
                                    int size,
                                    int style)
        Gives you a font with the specified size, specified style, and default font. Clients should not dispose the font returned by this function call, as the owner is FontFactory.
        Parameters:
        dev - Device object off of which to create the font.
        Returns:
        Font

      • getFont

        public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font getFont(int size,
                                    int style)
        Gives you the default font with the specified size and style. Clients should not dispose the font returned by this function call, as the owner is FontFactory.
        Returns:
        Font

      • getFont

        public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font getFont(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device dev,
                                    int size,
                                    int style,
                                    java.lang.String name)
        Gives you a font with the specified size, specified style, and specified font. Clients should not dispose the font returned by this function call, as the owner is FontFactory.
        Parameters:
        dev - Device object off of which to create the font.
        Returns:
        Font

      • disposeAll

        public static void disposeAll()
        Disposes all the fonts and clears the internal storage of fonts. Does not do ref counting, so use this with care.
